summary: My first retexture.  Makes daedric armor more benevolent looking for \"good guy\" players.
descriptionHtml:
==========
Overview
==========

Fairly self explanatory.  Gives a \"holier\" look than the standard black daedric armor with red glow.  Preferable to players going for a righteous playstyle.

Armor is now white with gold trim and the red glow effect is now blue.

Installation is simple and only takes a few seconds.

Feel free to comment with any criticism, suggestions, issues, and of course, comments, or shoot me an email (email address is in readme file along with installation instructions).

Do as you please with this mod, just give credit where credit is due.

If asked, I will make a tutorial on changing the color of the glow.
(Done, find my tutorial at http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RdDKs9gYguY )

==========
Versions
==========

Ver 1.1 adds an enhanced glow effect (more noticeable, though some may find it overpowering).
The download you choose is completely up to you. (This is my preferred version, to be honest)

Ver 1.5 adds a \"radiant\" glow to the entire set of armor.  Due to changed shaders, may be buggy.  Available with the 1.0 blue glow or the 1.1 enhanced glow.  If the standard armor is preferred without the radiant effect, it is perfectly acceptable to download 1.0 or 1.1.

Ver 2.0 adds \"Aedric Armor\" [credit to phantur for that name] as a separate item.  It is currently craftable in the same way as daedric.  The world texture still shows the regular daedric armor, but when worn, it is my version.  For now, the glow effect has been removed due to errors.  When I figure out the problem, I\'ll update with the glow again, as well as update the world texture.

Thanks,
~Sirspen

=================================
ITAQ (Important to answer questions)
=================================

Q. Is this a replacer? Will my dremoras also be wearing a holy set of armor?
A. Unfortunately, yes.  Version 2.0 will be released when the Creation Kit comes out (presumably this month) and with that will come the item as a separate instance and will be a separate smithing item as well (in case you would like to look holy and have a dark looking follower, or vice-versa).

Q. Is there a female version as well?
A. Yep, included in both versions

Q. Do I have to download version 1.1 or 1.5?
A. No.  Version 1.1 is simply the same retexture with a stronger glow effect, while version 1.5 changes a shader, making the whole armor glow white.  If you find either to be too overpowering, version 1.0 will work just fine.
